column4: does anyone know how to create multiple small zip files out of one big file?  I have a file too big to store on a fat32 hdd
any problem with just using 'split'?
yes, you have the 'cat' command on osx
can you explain the steps for me.  thanks
you would split the files (split's man page should be an easy read), then to put the together you just do: cat file1 file2 ... fileN > file
ok, thanks
i am having trouble figuring out the split command in the man pages
split -b SIZE FILE

that's what i have been trying, but i cannot figure out the whole numbering thing.  If i want a 100 mb split i am not sure what numbers to type in.  Same goes for a 4 GB split.  It's very confusing to me
the man page describes the format at the bottom.  100 mb would be: 100MB
Sorry.  It's 100M.  See the difference in the man page
it says "MB 1000*1000".  Ok.  and would 4 GB be 4 G?
yes
i typed in "sudo split -d 100M ~/Desktop/ubuntu* ~/test/testing" and i get an error that says "split:  extra operand"  but it appears to be working.  Thank you so much
now i will just type "sudo cat (and then each file path)" and it will work?
no sudo.  You can do: cat file1 file2 ... fileN > file
what does the fileN > file mean?
I just mean the last file, so if you had 3 files (N = 3): cat file1 file2 file3 > file
is the "> file" where you are saving it?
exactly
thank you
